column4: I want to open the file while it is still on the other computer.
it should mount it somewhere, in /media maybe?
try typing mount at the terminal - it should list all the mounted filesystems / servers
try typing mount then
just do it already
Whops ^^
type mount....
please, type mount.
Whops.  You are right.  It's under ~/.gvfs
cool :-)
no worries :)
It goes and comes back.
what kind of server is it ?
It's a Debian server.
I mean samba, nfs, etc ?
Ohh, I mounted it via ssh.
sftp.
you could mount it via the command line, automount, or fstab then I guess
I didn't think that worked over ssh.
it it does, that would be ideal.
Thanks for the help.  I should have though of mount myself.  I will look into either sshfs or NFS later.  This will do for now.  Bye.
ok good luck - sshfs will work quite easily for you :)
